title: WCAS ENGLISH 101-6-20 First-Year Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This writing-intensive course focuses on a number of classics by cinema's "master of suspense," Alfred Hitchcock. Films will likely include Vertigo, Psycho and North by Northwest. The last third of the class will focus on Hitchcock's legacy and influence, e.g. Chris Marker's La Jetée and John Carpenter's Halloween. Our primary focus, however, will always lie with attending to the ways film style affects the treatment of key themes across Hitchcock's filmography: from mistaken identity and sexual politics to horror and voyeurism. Assignments will include short essays and several digital editing projects including making animated .gifs and supercuts. No prior technical experience will be presumed.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Several analytical papers and experimental digital editing projects plus class participation.
